doc.title: TURN

value.content: TURN (Traversal Using Relays around NAT) is a protocol enabling a computer to receive and send data from behind a Network Address Translator (NAT) or firewall. TURN is used by WebRTC to allow any two devices on the Internet to enter a peer-to-peer connection.

value.title: See also
value.content:

  • Specification
  • Specification update for IPv6
